channel.title: audio on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in audio on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Atlantic Records Logo
Atlantic Recording Corporation is an American record label founded in October 1947 by Ahmet Ertegun and Herb Abramson. Over its first 20 years of operation, Atlantic earned a reputation as one of the most important American labels, specializing in jazz, R&B, and soul by Aretha Franklin, Ray Charles, Wilson Pickett, Sam and Dave, Ruth Brown and Otis Redding. Its position was greatly improved by its distribution deal with Stax. In 1967, Atlantic became a wholly owned subsidiary of Warner Bros.
You can download theAtlantic Recordslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Atlantic Records
item.description: Atlantic Recording Corporation is an American record label founded in October 1947 by Ahmet Ertegun and Herb Abramson. Over its first 20 years of operation, Atlantic earned a reputation as one of the most important American labels, specializing in jazz, R&B, and soul by Aretha Franklin, Ray Charles, Wilson Pickett, Sam and Dave, Ruth Brown and Otis Redding. Its position was greatly improved by its distribution deal with Stax. In 1967, Atlantic became a wholly owned subsidiary of Warner Bros.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Ayre Acoustics Logo Ayre Acoustics Inc. is an American manufacturer of high-performance, high-fidelity audio components and systems co-founded in 1993 by Charles Hansen, Katie Lehr, and Peter Bohacek. The audio output circuitry of the PonoPlayer was designed by engineers at Ayre Acoustics. Source
You can download theAyre Acousticslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Ayre Acoustics
item.description: Ayre Acoustics Inc. is an American manufacturer of high-performance, high-fidelity audio components and systems co-founded in 1993 by Charles Hansen, Katie Lehr, and Peter Bohacek. The audio output circuitry of the PonoPlayer was designed by engineers at Ayre Acoustics. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Riedel Communications Logo RIEDEL Communications GmbH & Co. KG is a German manufacturer of communications equipment and an equipment distributor. Riedel was founded in 1987 in Wuppertal, Germany by Thomas Riedel. Riedel has three business segments: Manufacture of communication equipment, rental service and radio distribution. The company has over 700 employees and is based in the “RIEDEL Technologie Park”. Source
You can download theRiedel Communicationslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Riedel Communications
item.description: RIEDEL Communications GmbH & Co. KG is a German manufacturer of communications equipment and an equipment distributor. Riedel was founded in 1987 in Wuppertal, Germany by Thomas Riedel. Riedel has three business segments: Manufacture of communication equipment, rental service and radio distribution. The company has over 700 employees and is based in the “RIEDEL Technologie Park”. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 NHT Loudspeakers Logo
NHT Loudspeakers, often colloquially referred to as NHT Audio, is an American loudspeaker and audio component company based in Benicia, California. The company was founded by Chris Byrne and Ken Kantor in December 1986. NHT home theater products have historically included loudspeakers, A/V processors, and amplifiers. NHT professional processors and speakers are used in recording and production studios. The current NHT lineup consists solely of acoustic suspension loudspeakers and in-wall/in-ceiling speakers.
You can download theNHTlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: NHT
item.description: NHT Loudspeakers, often colloquially referred to as NHT Audio, is an American loudspeaker and audio component company based in Benicia, California. The company was founded by Chris Byrne and Ken Kantor in December 1986. NHT home theater products have historically included loudspeakers, A/V processors, and amplifiers. NHT professional processors and speakers are used in recording and production studios. The current NHT lineup consists solely of acoustic suspension loudspeakers and in-wall/in-ceiling speakers.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Boston Acoustics Logo
Boston Acoustics is an American manufacturer of home and mobile audio equipment founded in 1979 by Advent veterans Andy Pettit and Frank Reed. Andy Kotsatos was known as Andy Pettit. His grandfather immigrated to the United States and worked as a waiter in a French restaurant. Because of his small stature, the rest of the staff named him Le Petit: French for small. Eventually bending to the social pressure to Americanize, he changed his name from Kostatsos to Pettit.
You can download theBoston Acousticslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Boston Acoustics
item.description: Boston Acoustics is an American manufacturer of home and mobile audio equipment founded in 1979 by Advent veterans Andy Pettit and Frank Reed. Andy Kotsatos was known as Andy Pettit. His grandfather immigrated to the United States and worked as a waiter in a French restaurant. Because of his small stature, the rest of the staff named him Le Petit: French for small. Eventually bending to the social pressure to Americanize, he changed his name from Kostatsos to Pettit.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Rotel Logo
Rotel is a family-owned Japanese manufacturer of hi-fi audio and video equipment: home theater, amplifiers, compact disc players, etc. Rotel was started by Tomoki Tachikawa in Tokyo Japan in 1957 as a hi-fi electronics manufacturer. It is currently run by the nephew, Peter Kao. In the early 1980s Rotel joined the B&W Group forming a strategic alliance with Bowers & Wilkins and established exclusive distribution networks in North America and several European markets.
You can download theRotellogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Rotel
item.description: Rotel is a family-owned Japanese manufacturer of hi-fi audio and video equipment: home theater, amplifiers, compact disc players, etc. Rotel was started by Tomoki Tachikawa in Tokyo Japan in 1957 as a hi-fi electronics manufacturer. It is currently run by the nephew, Peter Kao. In the early 1980s Rotel joined the B&W Group forming a strategic alliance with Bowers & Wilkins and established exclusive distribution networks in North America and several European markets.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Ableton Logo Ableton AG is a German music software company that produces and distributes the production and performance program Ableton Live and a collection of related instruments and sample libraries, as well as their own hardware controller Ableton Push. Ableton’s office is located in the Prenzlauer Berg district of Berlin, Germany, with a second office in Pasadena, California. Source
You can download theAbletonlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Ableton
item.description: Ableton AG is a German music software company that produces and distributes the production and performance program Ableton Live and a collection of related instruments and sample libraries, as well as their own hardware controller Ableton Push. Ableton’s office is located in the Prenzlauer Berg district of Berlin, Germany, with a second office in Pasadena, California. Source

AMX Logo
AMX (formerly AMX, LLC) is an American manufacturer of video switching and control devices. It is currently owned by Samsung Electronics through Harman International Industries, and is part of the Harman Professional Division. Source
You can download theAMXlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: AMX
item.description: AMX (formerly AMX, LLC) is an American manufacturer of video switching and control devices. It is currently owned by Samsung Electronics through Harman International Industries, and is part of the Harman Professional Division. Source

 Audio-Technica Corporation (株式会社オーディオテクニカ) Logo
Audio-Technica Corporation (株式会社オーディオテクニカ Kabushiki Kaisha Ōdio Tekunika) is a Japanese company that designs and manufactures professional microphones, headphones, phonographic magnetic cartridges, and other audio equipment. Source
You can download theAudio-Technicalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

item.description: Audio-Technica Corporation (株式会社オーディオテクニカ Kabushiki Kaisha Ōdio Tekunika) is a Japanese company that designs and manufactures professional microphones, headphones, phonographic magnetic cartridges, and other audio equipment. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Beats Electronics Logo
Beats Electronics LLC (also known as Beats by Dr. Dre, or simply Beats by Dre) is a subsidiary of Apple Inc. that produces audio products. Headquartered in Culver City, California, the company was founded by music producer and rapper Dr. Dre and Interscope Records co-founder Jimmy Iovine. Source
You can download theBeatslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Beats
item.description: Beats Electronics LLC (also known as Beats by Dr. Dre, or simply Beats by Dre) is a subsidiary of Apple Inc. that produces audio products. Headquartered in Culver City, California, the company was founded by music producer and rapper Dr. Dre and Interscope Records co-founder Jimmy Iovine. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Bose Corporation Logo
Bose Corporation is a manufacturing company which predominantly sells audio equipment. The company was established by Amar Bose in 1964 and is based in Framingham, Massachusetts. Bose is best known for its home audio systems and speakers, noise-cancelling headphones, professional audio products and automobile sound systems. Bose has a reputation for being particularly protective of its patents, trademarks, and brands. Source
You can download theBoselogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Bose
item.description: Bose Corporation is a manufacturing company which predominantly sells audio equipment. The company was established by Amar Bose in 1964 and is based in Framingham, Massachusetts. Bose is best known for its home audio systems and speakers, noise-cancelling headphones, professional audio products and automobile sound systems. Bose has a reputation for being particularly protective of its patents, trademarks, and brands. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Crown International Logo
Crown International, or Crown Audio, is an American manufacturer of audio electronics, and is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which has been part of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics since 2017. Today, the company is known primarily for its power amplifiers, but has also manufactured microphones, a line of commercial audio products as well as digital audio networking products. Source
You can download theCrown Audiologo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Crown Audio
item.description: Crown International, or Crown Audio, is an American manufacturer of audio electronics, and is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which has been part of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics since 2017. Today, the company is known primarily for its power amplifiers, but has also manufactured microphones, a line of commercial audio products as well as digital audio networking products. Source

 dbx, Inc. Logo
dbx, Inc. is an American producer of professional audio recording equipment owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean firm Samsung Electronics. It was founded by David E. Blackmer in 1971. Source
You can download thedbxlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: dbx

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Harman International Logo
Harman International Industries, Inc., commonly known as Harman, is a subsidiary of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics that produces, designs and engineers connected products for automakers, consumers and enterprises worldwide, including connected car systems; audio and visual products, enterprise automation; and connected services. Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, Harman maintains major operations in the Americas, Europe, as well as Asia and markets its products under several brands; such as AKG, AMX, Becker, Crown, Harman Kardon, Infinity, JBL, Lexicon, dbx, DigiTech, Mark Levinson, Martin, Revel, Soundcraft, Studer, Arcam, and BSS Audio.
You can download theHarmanlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Harman
item.description: Harman International Industries, Inc., commonly known as Harman, is a subsidiary of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics that produces, designs and engineers connected products for automakers, consumers and enterprises worldwide, including connected car systems; audio and visual products, enterprise automation; and connected services. Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, Harman maintains major operations in the Americas, Europe, as well as Asia and markets its products under several brands; such as AKG, AMX, Becker, Crown, Harman Kardon, Infinity, JBL, Lexicon, dbx, DigiTech, Mark Levinson, Martin, Revel, Soundcraft, Studer, Arcam, and BSS Audio.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 JBL Logo
Harman Kardon (styled as harman / kardon) is a division of Stamford-based Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean firm Samsung Electronics, and manufactures home and car audio equipment. It was its original division, founded in 1953 by Sidney Harman and Bernard Kardon. Source
You can download theHarman Kardonlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Harman Kardon
item.description: Harman Kardon (styled as harman / kardon) is a division of Stamford-based Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean firm Samsung Electronics, and manufactures home and car audio equipment. It was its original division, founded in 1953 by Sidney Harman and Bernard Kardon. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lexicon Logo
Lexicon is an American company that engineers, manufactures, and markets audio equipment as a brand of Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korea-based firm Samsung Electronics. The company was founded in 1971 and headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts with offices in Salt Lake City. It was acquired by Harman in 1993. Source
You can download theLexiconlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Lexicon
item.description: Lexicon is an American company that engineers, manufactures, and markets audio equipment as a brand of Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korea-based firm Samsung Electronics. The company was founded in 1971 and headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts with offices in Salt Lake City. It was acquired by Harman in 1993. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Mark Levinson Audio Systems Logo
Mark Levinson is an American high-end audio equipment brand established in 1972 by eponymous founder Mark Levinson, and based in Stamford, Connecticut. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean company Samsung Electronics. Source
You can download theMark Levinsonlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Mark Levinson
item.description: Mark Levinson is an American high-end audio equipment brand established in 1972 by eponymous founder Mark Levinson, and based in Stamford, Connecticut. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean company Samsung Electronics. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Martin Professional Logo
Martin Professional is a Danish manufacturer and distributor of stage and architectural lighting and effects fixtures. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Aarhus, Denmark. Source
You can download theMartinlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Martin
item.description: Martin Professional is a Danish manufacturer and distributor of stage and architectural lighting and effects fixtures. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Aarhus, Denmark. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Revel Logo
Revel is an American manufacturer and distributor of high-end luxury audio loudspeakers. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Stamford, Connecticut, United States. Source
You can download theRevellogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Revel
item.description: Revel is an American manufacturer and distributor of high-end luxury audio loudspeakers. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Stamford, Connecticut, United States. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Sonos Logo
Sonos is an American consumer electronics company based in Santa Barbara, California. It was founded in 2002 by John MacFarlane, Craig Shelburne, Tom Cullen, and Trung Mai, and is currently run by Patrick Spence. Sonos is widely known for the smart speakers it develops and manufactures. Sonos products are designed to allow speakers to play music simultaneously in multiple rooms. Source
You can download theSonoslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Sonos
item.description: Sonos is an American consumer electronics company based in Santa Barbara, California. It was founded in 2002 by John MacFarlane, Craig Shelburne, Tom Cullen, and Trung Mai, and is currently run by Patrick Spence. Sonos is widely known for the smart speakers it develops and manufactures. Sonos products are designed to allow speakers to play music simultaneously in multiple rooms. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Soundcraft Logo
Soundcraft is a British designer and importer (formerly a manufacturer) of mixing consoles and other professional audio equipment. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which is owned by South Korean company Samsung Electronics. It was founded by sound engineer Phil Dudderidge and electronics designer Graham Blyth in 1973. Source
You can download theSoundcraftlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Soundcraft
item.description: Soundcraft is a British designer and importer (formerly a manufacturer) of mixing consoles and other professional audio equipment. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which is owned by South Korean company Samsung Electronics. It was founded by sound engineer Phil Dudderidge and electronics designer Graham Blyth in 1973. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Studer Logo
Studer is a Swiss designer and manufacturer of audio equipment for recording studios and broadcasters. The company was founded in Zürich, Switzerland, in 1948 by Willi Studer. It initially became known in the 1950s for its professional tape recorders. In the 1990s the company moved into the manufacture of mixing consoles. Source
You can download theStuderlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Studer
item.description: Studer is a Swiss designer and manufacturer of audio equipment for recording studios and broadcasters. The company was founded in Zürich, Switzerland, in 1948 by Willi Studer. It initially became known in the 1950s for its professional tape recorders. In the 1990s the company moved into the manufacture of mixing consoles. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Yamaha Corporation Logo
Yamaha Corporation is a Japanese multinational corporation and conglomerate with a very wide range of products and services. It is one of the constituents of Nikkei 225 and is the world’s largest piano manufacturing company. The former motorcycle division was established in 1955 as Yamaha Motor Co., Ltd., which started as an affiliated company but later became independent, although Yamaha Corporation is still a major shareholder. Source
You can download theYamahalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Yamaha
item.description: Yamaha Corporation is a Japanese multinational corporation and conglomerate with a very wide range of products and services. It is one of the constituents of Nikkei 225 and is the world’s largest piano manufacturing company. The former motorcycle division was established in 1955 as Yamaha Motor Co., Ltd., which started as an affiliated company but later became independent, although Yamaha Corporation is still a major shareholder. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 AKG Acoustics Logo
AKG Acoustics (originally Akustische und Kino-Geräte Gesellschaft m.b.H., English: Acoustic and Cinema Equipment) is an acoustics engineering and manufacturing company. It was founded in 1947 by Dr. Rudolf Görike and Ernest Plass in Vienna, Austria. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, a division of Samsung Electronics. Source
You can download theAKGlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: AKG
item.description: AKG Acoustics (originally Akustische und Kino-Geräte Gesellschaft m.b.H., English: Acoustic and Cinema Equipment) is an acoustics engineering and manufacturing company. It was founded in 1947 by Dr. Rudolf Görike and Ernest Plass in Vienna, Austria. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, a division of Samsung Electronics. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Shure Incorporated Logo Shure Incorporated is an American audio products corporation. It was founded by Sidney N. Shure in Chicago, Illinois in 1925 as a supplier of radio parts kits. The company became a consumer and professional audio-electronics manufacturer of microphones, wireless microphone systems, phonograph cartridges, discussion systems, mixers, and digital signal processing. The company also manufactures listening products, including headphones, high-end earphones, and personal monitor systems. Source Source
You can download theShurelogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Shure
item.description: Shure Incorporated is an American audio products corporation. It was founded by Sidney N. Shure in Chicago, Illinois in 1925 as a supplier of radio parts kits. The company became a consumer and professional audio-electronics manufacturer of microphones, wireless microphone systems, phonograph cartridges, discussion systems, mixers, and digital signal processing. The company also manufactures listening products, including headphones, high-end earphones, and personal monitor systems. Source Source
